Title: Majnun Seated in the Wilderness with Laylá on a Camel
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript w.638 depicts Majnun, sitting on the side of the road, while Laylá passes by, mounted on a camel.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Sufism; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: 'Abd Allah al-Muradi, 1132 AH/AD 1719 [mode of acquisition unknown] [seal impression fol. 91b]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hafiz (Persian, flourished 8th century AH/AD 14th century)
